item.title: 波德斯塔表示：尽管特朗普在野，美国仍将参与全球气候斗争
item.description:
美国最高谈判代表约翰-波德斯塔（John Podesta）在今年的 COP29 峰会开幕式上表达了歉意。【原文：

John Podesta, the top US negotiator, struck at apologetic note at the opening of this year’s COP29 summit.

】

item.title: COP29: 巴库只有一个故事
item.description:
Bloomberg Green正在阿塞拜疆实地报道联合国气候会谈。【原文：

Bloomberg Green is on the ground covering the UN climate talks in Azerbaijan.

】

item.title: COP29 谈判代表就全球碳市场机制达成一致
item.description: 在 COP29 气候峰会的第一天，气候谈判代表们就联合国管理的全球碳市场规则达成一致，从而取得了突破性进展。【原文：Climate negotiators secured a breakthrough on day one of the COP29 climate summit by agreeing on rules for a United Nations-administered global carbon market.】

item.title: 拜登不顾特朗普当选，继续征收甲烷税
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，根据拜登政府将于周二敲定的一项规定，美国的石油和天然气生产商将首次被要求为其排放的部分甲烷付费。【原文：Oil and gas producers in the US will for the first time be required to pay for some of their methane emissions under a regulation the Biden administration is set to finalize Tuesday, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国电力公司听从州领导人的呼吁，将气候目标置于变化之中
item.description: 在新任首席执行官比尔-费尔曼（Bill Fehrman）的领导下，美国电力公司（American Electric Power Co.他说，这可能会导致电力公司 2045 年净零碳目标的改变。【原文：American Electric Power Co. is taking direction from state regulators on their energy and economic development goals under new CEO Bill Fehrman. That may lead to a change in the utility’s 2045 net-zero carbon target, he said.】

item.title: 世界需要气候领袖。阿塞拜疆能否挺身而出？
item.description:
"请不要忘记，战争和冲突会产生大量的废气排放，"COP29主席穆赫塔尔-巴巴耶夫（Mukhtar Babayev）在本周的《零点》节目中说道。【原文：

“Please do not forget that from war, from conflicts, come a huge amount of emissions,” COP29 President Mukhtar Babayev says on this week’s episode of Zero.

】

item.title: 新研究发现：全球变暖已接近 1.5C
item.description:
科学家利用一种新的计算方法发现，全球气温上升距离《巴黎协定》规定的上限仅有一线之隔。【原文：

Using a new calculation method, scientists find that global temperature rise is within a hair’s breadth of the Paris Agreement limit. 

】

item.title: 南非经济中心将快速采取措施结束水资源危机
item.description: 南非水务部长表示，南非的商业中心约翰内斯堡将采取一系列措施改善供水，防止水龙头干涸。【原文：South Africa’s commercial hub Johannesburg will take a series of steps to improve water supply and stop its taps from running dry, the country’s water minister said.】

item.title: 欧洲人又将迎来一个寒冷的冬天
item.description: 气候预测显示，欧洲又将迎来一个比往年温和的冬季，这可能有助于缓解对天然气的需求。【原文：Climate forecasts show Europeans are in store for another milder-than-usual winter, potentially helping to relieve demand for natural gas.】

item.title: 世界上最糟糕的空气让近半数德里人求医问药
item.description: 一项新的调查显示，德里及其周边地区近一半的家庭因呼吸道疾病就医，而这些疾病都与席卷首都的严重污染有关。【原文：Nearly half the families in and around Delhi have sought medical help for respiratory ailments connected to severe pollution engulfing the capital, according to a new survey.】

item.title: 塞内加尔有望承诺实施 27 亿美元的绿色转型计划
item.description: 一位主要资助方表示，塞内加尔有望最早在本月于阿塞拜疆举行的 COP29 国际气候大会上再次承诺实施一项 25 亿欧元（约合 26.7 亿美元）的计划，以减少对化石燃料的依赖。【原文：Senegal is expected to recommit to a €2.5 billion ($2.67 billion) program to reduce its reliance on fossil fuels as early as this month’s COP29 international climate conference in Azerbaijan, a key funder said.】

item.title: 新台风袭击菲律宾北部，农作物损失不断增加
item.description: 一场热带风暴在周末加强，并以台风的形式在菲律宾北部登陆，菲律宾正在努力应对今年一系列无情气旋造成的数百万美元的农作物损失。【原文：A tropical storm that strengthened over the weekend made landfall as a typhoon in the northern Philippines, as the country grapples with millions of dollars in crop damage from a series of relentless cyclones this year.】

item.title: 特朗普获胜颠覆了 COP29 上的气候现金争夺战
item.description:
在本周举行的联合国年度峰会上，近200个国家必须考虑如何在没有世界最大经济体帮助的情况下避免灾难性的气候变化。【原文：

Nearly 200 nations meeting at an annual United Nations summit this week must now consider how to avoid catastrophic climate change without help from the world's biggest economy.

】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 本周，近 200 个国家齐聚 COP29，参加一年一度的联合国气候峰会，这是国际社会为遏制全球变暖所做的最新努力。铜多头汇聚上海，参加全球最大的工业金属集会之一。在美国，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在大选中获胜，成为石油市场潜在影响的焦点。【原文：Nearly 200 nations gather this week for COP29, the annual United Nations climate summit, in the latest international push to tame global warming. Copper bulls converge on Shanghai for one of the world’s biggest gatherings for the industrial metal. And in the US, Donald Trump’s election victory casts a spotlight on the potential impacts to oil markets.】

item.title: 做空特斯拉的对冲基金损失超过 50 亿美元
item.description: 自唐纳德-特朗普赢得大选以来，坚持押注特斯拉公司的对冲基金已经损失了数十亿美元，因为他们感受到了当选总统与埃隆-马斯克之间特殊关系的影响。【原文：Since Donald Trump’s election win, the hedge funds clinging on to bets against Tesla Inc. have lost billions of dollars, as they feel the fallout of the special relationship between the president-elect and Elon Musk.】

item.title: 本田新型电动汽车悄然超越特斯拉
item.description:
由于忠实的本田车主纷纷选择电动汽车，Prologue 的销量仅用了几个月就超过了美国的大多数电动汽车。【原文：

It took only a few months for sales of the Prologue to pass most of the electron-powered cars in the US as loyal Honda owners go electric.

】

item.title: 北部风暴托拉吉加剧，菲律宾进入警戒状态
item.description: 由于 "托拉吉 "已加强为强热带风暴，预计将于周一在菲律宾北部登陆，菲律宾已进入警戒状态。【原文：The Philippines is on alert as Toraji intensified into a severe tropical storm and is expected to make landfall in the north on Monday.】

item.title: 尽管可能付出代价，加州仍强化气候燃料规则
item.description: 尽管人们担心此举会使每加仑汽油的价格增加近 50 美分，但加州监管机构还是收紧了对该州销售的燃料碳强度的要求。【原文：California regulators tightened requirements for the carbon intensity of fuels sold in the state, despite fears the move could add nearly 50 cents to the price of a gallon of gasoline.】

item.title: 反犹太袭击事件发生后，荷兰总理取消了巴库 COP29 之行
item.description: 荷兰首相迪克-肖夫（Dick Schoof）在以色列球迷在荷兰遭到袭击后取消了前往阿塞拜疆参加联合国气候峰会的行程。【原文：Dutch Prime Minister Dick Schoof canceled his trip to the United Nations climate summit in Azerbaijan after attacks against Israeli football fans in the Netherlands.】

item.title: 特朗普对热泵和电动汽车激励政策未来的影响
item.description:
当选总统威胁要废除《通货膨胀削减法》，但这可能会在政治和法律上对家庭脱碳税收抵免和退税造成挑战。【原文：

The president-elect has threatened to rescind the Inflation Reduction Act, but that may prove politically and legally challenging for home decarbonization tax credits and rebates. 

】

item.title: 纽约市迎来史上最干旱的秋季
item.description:
纽约市迎来了有史以来最干燥的秋季，9 月至 10 月间，中央公园的降雨量不足两英寸。【原文：

New York City has had the driest fall on record, with less than two inches of rain recorded in Central Park between September and October.

】

item.title: 三位 COP29 与会者如何在没有长途飞行的情况下抵达巴库
item.description:
从英国到阿塞拜疆联合国气候峰会为期两周的史诗般的铁路和公共汽车之旅表明，低碳交通方式虽然速度较慢，但可能更有趣。【原文：

An epic two-week rail and bus journey from the UK to the United Nations climate summit in Azerbaijan shows lower carbon transport options are slower, but possibly more fun. 

】

item.title: 巴西能拯救亚马逊雨林吗？玛丽娜-席尔瓦正在尝试
item.description:
巴西环境部长是一位著名的前活动家，曾帮助将气候变化问题推到卢拉总统议程的首位。她的下一个任务是为世界做同样的事情。【原文：

Brazil’s environment minister, a renowned former activist, helped push climate change to the top of President Lula’s agenda. Her next task is to do the same thing for the world. 

】

item.title: 报告发现加拿大新石油管道价值高达 240 亿美元
item.description: 加拿大政府支出监督机构得出结论，在跨山管道建设成本大幅超支后，该项目仍具有很高的价值。【原文：A project to triple the capacity of the Trans Mountain Pipeline still has a high value after massive cost overruns to build it, Canada’s government spending watchdog concluded.】

item.title: 特朗普的回归将重振对气候初创企业的投资
item.description:
当选总统对气候技术的敌意让风险投资家开始考虑如何介入并扶持该行业。【原文：

The president-elect’s hostility to climate tech has venture capitalists already thinking about how to step in and buoy the sector.

】

item.title: 新泽西州小规模山火导致纽约市上空浓烟滚滚
item.description: 新泽西州卑尔根县的一场小火燃烧起来，浓烟越过哈德逊河飘向纽约市。【原文：A small fire burning in New Jersey’s Bergen County has sent smoke wafting across the Hudson River into New York City.】

item.title: 特朗普对拜登的气候法 "虎视眈眈"：绿色日报
item.description: 今天的时事通讯探讨了在唐纳德-特朗普赢得第二个任期后，《通货膨胀削减法》的修改前景。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读全文。有关气候和清洁能源的更多报道，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at the prospect of changes to the Inflation Reduction Act now that Donald Trump has won a second term. You can read the full version on Bloomberg.com. For more climate and clean energy coverage, please subscribe.】

item.title: 这些科学家改变了本地新闻谈论气候变化的方式
item.description:
归因科学领域已经发展成熟，能够对极端天气进行近乎实时的分析，为电视天气预报员提供了与公众互动的重要工具。【原文：

The field of attribution science has matured to provide near-real-time analysis of extreme weather, giving TV weathercasters a key tool to engage the public.

】

item.title: 吹叶机无法安静工作
item.description:
美国数十个城市正试图抑制燃气吹叶机的季节性噪音。但是，新的法规和罚款也引起了人们的抵制。【原文：

Scores of US cities are trying to muffle the seasonal din of gas-powered leaf blowers. But the new regulations and fines are generating resistance, too.  

】

item.title: 特朗普计划废除拜登的气候法。这并不容易
item.description:
石油公司和一些共和党立法者支持《通胀抑制法案》的部分内容，因此彻底废除该法案的可能性要小于制定新的限制、上限和到期日期。【原文：

Oil companies and some Republican lawmakers support parts of the Inflation Reduction Act, making outright repeal less likely than new restrictions, caps and expiration dates. 

】
